org.epochx.stats
Interface Stat

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractStat
public interface Stat

A Stat is both a statistic field and a way of generating a statistic dynamically.

Method Summary
 Stats.ExpiryEvent getExpiryEvent()
          Returns when the data for this statistics field expires.
 java.lang.Object getStatValue()
          Generates and returns a value for this statistic.
 

Method Detail

getExpiryEvent

Stats.ExpiryEvent getExpiryEvent()
Returns when the data for this statistics field expires. For example a value of CROSSOVER means it expires at the start of every crossover event, and as such is likely to be cleared or otherwise unreliable from then until the next time it is set.

Returns:
the event at which this statistics field is available to be cleared.

getStatValue

java.lang.Object getStatValue()
Generates and returns a value for this statistic. It is not necessary for a Stat to implement this method to do anything other than return null if the value is going to be provided directly to the Stats manager. However, if this stat is requested and the stats manager does not have a value for it then this method will be called to attempt to generate it. It is typical for a stat that implements this method to request other stats that it is dependent upon from the stats manager.

Returns:
an Object value for this stat. The actual type of the value returned will be dependent upon the stat that it represents.
